text: Clear yellow. Light sweet grass hops. Light watery body, hunt of orange citrus. Tasty
Hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is malts, dry, light hops and earth. Smooth palate, bready malts, dough, faint hops and a nice finish.

Can in Seattle. From one of the generous boxes Chris has sent me. Soft white cap, proper pale yellow body with some rising bubbles. Cool sweet straw aroma. First impression is sweet and creamy, but a reasonable crispness comes in underneath. A touch of syrup sweetness with a nice dry, crisp bitterness. Grassy, pale fruit juice. Some banana and ester, which is strange. A bit brighter, with more tropical fruits, than I had expected. Certainly not traditional but it has some things going for it.

Slight grainy aroma, slightly hazy straw color with a white head. Very light bodied, and easy drinking. Theres a touch of sweetness, and grain, but without the hint of apple that is generally noticeable in a Kolsch. Overall, its a light easy drinking beer, thats easy approachable.
Draft. Clear straw color, small head. Sulfur, grass, corn and honey. Light body, lively carbonation. Light sweetness, medium bitterness.
Draft - pours yellow white head -nose/taste of pine, hoppy notes and light bread - med body
Draft - Loght grains and honey. Hazy light gold with a decent white head. Loght grains, dry and a touch of lemon.

12 oz. can from thebaldwizard. Thanks Joe! It pours a very pale, mostly clear yellow color with a small, creamy lasting head. The aroma jumps out with fresh baked bread, lemon and light herbal lemongrass notes. The flavor is pretty much the same with dense bready, lightly doughy malts. Hints of concrete and earthy, lemony hops are present, but not strong. The body is kind of full and bready/yeasty yet dry and well attenuated. Decent, but the concrete notes, full body and over lemony hops keep it from being super refreshing.
Really pale straw color out of the tap with a thin white head. Light toasted white bread nose with hints of lemon. Thin grainy taste with some bitter lemon citrus. Really not much here.

Can at home. Pours a slightly hazy, pale yellow with a fluffy white head. Aroma is light grain, faint lemon. Taste is citrus, faint cracker, light lemon zest. Light body and medium carbonation. Not bad.

Fresh 12 oz can, thanks Matt B! Hazy gold with lasting fizzy head. Aroma of straw, grain, corn and mild yeast. Yes... It is spot on for the style. Grainy corn base with a mild sweet malt finish. Hop profile is low and completly untraceable. For the still it is pretty good with a pleasing mouthfeel.

12oz can thanks to Jeff. Pours out a pale straw color topped with a white head. Nose is vegetable some honey and a little cereal malt. Taste is more of the vegetable some earthy tones and a light sweetness. Very drinkable.

on tap @ MadTree / Cincinnati OH --- Clear light amber color, white head cover, hanging streamers of lace. Aroma of light malt and hay. Taste is fizzy light malt with overtones of spice, moving through a big fizzy swallow to light hops in a medium finish. A decent traditional Kolsch.
DeScription says it all. ...nothing fancy. Lots of corn. Tasted at Lauren and Andrews wedding.
Can at champps. Pour light as day. Crisp and clean. Apple notes and a bit of cereal too. Smooth and refreshing. Pretty tasty.

Canned 6/26/15 enjoyed 7/22/15 in a pint glass. 

Look - See through, even when cold. Pale yellow. Medium white head. Thick bubbles, light lacing. For the style, expected. My preference, no. 

Smell - Non-roasted malt. When stirred there is a faint sour aroma. Citrus. Not my "smell".

Taste - Very thin taste. A large part is grass. Faint citrus. Not my taste. 

Feel - I like the feel here. I would expect it to be overly carbonated but it is not. For the style, this is better than the normal. 

Overall - This is not my favorite MadTree brew. Far from it. Is it something to suggest to a wheat lover, yes. Is it something to suggest to one that still likes to drink Coors Light, yes. Is it something to suggest to a beer lover, no.
Sampler at Matt the Millers Tavern. Straw colored with a very thin white head. Light aromas of grass and bready notes. Lightly hopped. Crisp. Clean mouthfeel. Not bad.

Pours light clear golden. Light, flavory with anytime beer. Good overall! Crisp and nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can thanks to micham8. Pours crystal clear golden with a fizzy white head that dissipates quickly leaving nice residual and decent lacing. Aroma is kinda corny, grass, hay, grains. Flavor is light plus sweet, grainy and grassy, a biscuit kind of malt base. Tiny hint of green apple. Light body, spritzy mouthfeel.

Poured from a 12 ounce can, thanks to jsquire. This pours a straw yellow with a bright white head. The aroma is pilsner malt, cereal, light note of honey, no noticeable hop aroma. The flavor is grainy, cereal, soft huskiness, light spicy hop character. This is clean and crisp, solid Kolsch.

On tap in Easton mall in Columbus. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is light pilsner malt, light body, medium carbonation, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is light pilsner malt and crisp hop finish.

12 ounce can, canned on 11/03/2014 (date stamped on bottom of can). Served in a stange/Kölsch glass, the beer pours a gold color with about an inch white head that stuck around a while. Theres also a good amount of lacing. The aroma is nice, the brew smells like bready malt, grassy hops and some lemon/orange peel. Taste is similar to the aroma, but theres the addition of some honey and light floral hops. Mouthfeel/body is light, its crisp and its also easy and refreshing to drink. Id probably enjoy this more on a hot day, but it was in the 50s here today (which is nice for mid-December) so thats close enough for me. So far Im 3 for 3 with MadTree brews that Id like to try again. $1.67 a can at Grain and Grape.
12oz can from Luckys Market. Yellow gold pour with a sturdy bright white head. Aroma of wheat and lemon. Tastes of light malt, grass, bready, earthy, floral, light yeasty, light pepper.
A refreshing kolsch. Very crips. Clean. Sweet body. Light mouthfeel. Light and overall very well put together.
Can. Really really nice beer, but Im a sucker for the style. Smells sweet, fruity, apple, grape, sweet fruits. Crisp and easy to drink, light. Refreshing.

Sample at World of Beer Easton on 8/8/14. Pours a clear yellow with a medium white head. Aroma of sweet malt, lemon and some noble hop. Malty and sweet flavor with a bit of citrus before a noble hop finish.
Draft pour at the source. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head of foam. The aroma is bready, fruity, and yeasty. Tastes like crisp bread and dried fruit. Light body and medium carbonation.
Pours a light gold with a white head. Light hops or grass and malt of sugar or caramel and citrus. Light body with a thin bubbly texture.

When Mad Tree Lift was poured into the glass it has a rich head and as I was drinking it there was lacing on the glass. It has a rich cream taste with a citrus note while. The finish is very smooth. Havent had a bad beer from Mad Tree yet
Draft. Gold pour, small white head. Some retention/lace. Aroma of grain, grass, lemon. Taste is lightly sweet, grassy, lemon. Palate is drier, soft, slick, light finish.

Pours a clear golden yellow from the can with dissipating bubbly white head that leaves light lace. Aroma of bready grain and biscuits, kolsch yeast back end. Taste follows, a hint of citrus in there. Safe and easy, but highly drinkable and well done.

Pours a light, clear yellow with a white head. Aromas are sweet, grainy, and some grassiness coming through. Flavor adds a bit of citrusy lemon to the mix. Nice and refreshing. Very solid Kolsh and one of my new favorites for a hot day.

12 ounce can

I found this on a trip to the Party Source. Being a new Madtree I could not pass it up. They have a reputation for solid beers and I always love supporting the local breweries when I can. A fine example of a kolsch would be the perfect lawn mower beer for those who can find it on the shelves.

Aroma / Appearance - A semitransparent base glows with a golden warmth. Crisp white head provides a refreshing presence. Lemons, crisp wheat, and grainy edges are on the simple side although what more do you expect from a basic session beer.

Flavor / Palate - Dry lemons, ginger ale, and light hops refresh the tongue. A mellow beer opens up as it hits the palate. A decent beer would be unremarkable for many people but this is a Kolsch from a city known for its German heritage. For that it is well worth buying a pack.
Can. Slightly sweet, creamy barley malt aroma. Clear yellow with a large white head. Barley malt and light grassy hops flavor. Medium body, moderate carbonation.

It's got a bit of a sweet corn and mild hop bite and a bit of citrus. Probably one of the best Kolsches I've ever had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can thanks to DrSilverworm. Hazy light orange pour with a very small head that fades quickly. Aromas are crackers, grass, and light lemons. Taste has a slight sweet bread taste up front with a light bitterness in the spicy finish. Lots of grass and crackers throughout. Thin body makes it come off a little watery. A nice Kolsch.

12oz can into a pint glass.

Pours a clear light gold with a one finger white head. The head fades somewhat quickly but leaves a thin cap of lacing on the beer.

Aroma is extremely bread with some very light floral and citrus notes from the hops. Overwhelmingly malty though.

The flavor has lots of malty goodness but it is not sweet and remains restrained. Light lemon and orange is present in the background along with a light bitterness. Mouthfeel has some body to it but is light enough to be refreshing.

Overall, a nicely done Kolsch style beer. The breadiness is wonderful and it is very refreshing. Good job.
Can. Light floral barley malt aroma. Golden yellow with large white head. Creamy barley malt and light straw flavor. Nicely blended. Very pleasant.
I would say the Kolsch style is not very well appreciated here in the U.S., but it is a nice and easy-going beverage. MadTrees is smooth, creamy, with a slight twinge of citrus.

Draft at Taste Of Belgium in OTR on February 28, 2014. Medium gold hue with good clarity, medium bittersweet aroma with some fruit and earthy elements as well, nice bittersweet flavor--good assertive hops, but not overbearing. Fine brew and very good for style--or at least the versions Ive had of it in the US.

Poured from the can into a can pint glass (I really need to get some more proper German glassware). Nose is kind of a corn sweetness, a little wet hop on the nose as well? I really like the flavor, extremely refreshing! I could drink this all day. It helps that I love this style. A very well done Kölsch.

12oz can with no date on it - I pay tribute to this beverage from across the Ohio River by pouring into improper glassware: my Bubba Gump Shrimp glass. Nose is wet hay. Sip adds floral notes (AKA cardboard). Light and fairly refreshing considering its cold as balls in my basement. Short finish with intermittent pool sized waves of sweetness. I wish AndyReynolds were here to rip Lift a new one since he hates the style. Ohio tick #182.

From the can, six pack purchased at the Taproom. Some citrus on the nose but overall aroma is restrained. Grassiness. Light, crisp. Significant warm bread flavor. Finishes clear with more bitterness than the typical Kolsch. Great beer for that one guy that comes to your house wanting Miller Lite (which is no longer in my fridge) and as a break from heavier, hoppier, brews. Another solid offering form the beards at MadTree.
(tap) clear yellow colour with a small white head; aroma of sour fruit, noble hops; refreshing and pleasant flavour

Sample at Daily Growler during the Cincinnati Beer Invasion on 01/23/014: Clear pale golden color with a medium thin white head that recedes steadily to an outer ring. Spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, malt and fruit. Light-bodied and crisp with flavors of grassy hops, bready malt and fruit. The finish is fruity up front with a mildly bitter grassy hops aftertaste. Above average Kölsch overall.

Draft:
Clear, bubbly gold with a white head.
Honey, malt, aroma.
Lemon peel, citrus flavor.
Sweet and light.
A nicely sessionable little beer.
Draft light yellow. Nose very light, some sweet malt and faint spice. Taste up front all malt, wheaty finish. Very clean just not that exciting.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2013 Draft at Dutchs. Pours a clear gold with a finger of white head that laces the glass while settling into a lasting film. Aroma of straw, crackers, minerals, and husky grains. Flavor of pale and sweet malts, straw, faint fruit, sugar, and husky grain. Light-bodied, with modest carbonation and a dry mouthfeel that has a mineral character in the middle. Not bad.

Draft at Dutchs. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have mildly toasted malts, light citrus notes, yeast, pretty standard stuff for a Kolsch. I dont think there was anything bad about this, just nothing to get excited about either.

Tap. Poured clear golden color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate balanced malt and floral hop aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable beer and good for style.

On tap. Keg is labeled simply "Kolsch", filled 10-8-13. Mostly hazy golden yellow color. Thin white head, decent reaches of lace. Very nice looking. Good lightly grassy, bready nose, with a hint of lemon-citrus. Lighter to medium body. Very nice smooth, crisp carbonation, great texture. Moderate bitter taste, light sweet finish, bit of zest, hint of pepper. Very good, easy drinking refreshing kolsch, with a satisfying amount of bitterness

Draft to taster at Dutchs. This was also on draft yesterday at Craft Beer Oktoberfest. Looks good for the style; a very slightly cloudy full gold with foamy white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells skunky and hoppy with a notable lager yeast presence. Tastes like it smells with a bit of sweetness. Nice on the palate. A good example of the style.
